thing-type.label: GE 28175 (ZW3106) Plug-In Dual Smart Dimmer
thing-type.description: Plug-In Dual Smart Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt• Remote Control - Turn ON/OFF and control the brightness level of the connected lighting manually or remotely</p&gt <p&gt• Multi-Purpose - 2 USB ports (3.4A total) on each side of the device</p&gt <p&gt• Dual Outlets - Wirelessly control both outlets independently </p&gt <p&gt• Built-in Z-Wave range extender</p&gt <p&gt• OTA (Over-the-Air) Updateable - Utilizes the Z-Wave Firmware Update Meta Data command class </p&gt <p&gtMaximum load (Total): 120VAC, 300W (2.5A) Tungsten, 300W Incandescent, 100W Dimmable CFL/LED</p&gt <p&gtFor Indoor Use Only</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly press and release the button on the top of the device to enter inclusion mode.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly press and release the button on the top of the device to enter exclusion mode.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: command steps
parameter.description: number of steps or levels per dim command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen Receiving a Z-Wave Dim Command - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtBoth the number of steps (or levels) that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified to suit personal preferences. </p&gt <p&gtParameter 7 (number of steps or levels)</p&gt <p&gtParameter 8 (timing of the steps)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: command timing
parameter.description: timing of the command steps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen Receiving a Z-Wave Dim Command - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtThe number of steps that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified. The timing of the steps is in 10 millisecond intervals. The default setting “1” means the level will change every 10 milliseconds when the Dim Command is received, dimming will occur 3 times by default for a total of 30 ms. 255 would be every 2.55 seconds. Combined, the two parameters allow dim rates from 10 milliseconds to 4.2 minutes from maximum-to-minimum or minimum-to-maximum levels.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: number of steps or levels per dimmer button press<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtManual Control Dimming (pressing the Dimmer’s button) - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtBoth the number of steps (or levels) that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified to suit personal preferences. </p&gt <p&gtParameter 9 (number of steps or levels)</p&gt <p&gtParameter 10 (timing of the steps)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: manual timing
parameter.description: timing of the manual steps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtManual Control Dimming (pressing the Dimmer’s button) - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtThe number of steps that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified. The timing of the steps is in 10 millisecond intervals. The default setting “1” means the level will change every 10 milliseconds when the Dimmer button is pressed, by default, dimming will occur 3 times per press for a total of 30 ms. 255 would be every 2.55 seconds. Combined, the two parameters allow dim rates from 10 milliseconds to 4.2 minutes from maximum-to-minimum or minimum-to-maximum levels.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: number of steps or levels per all on/off command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen Receiving an All-On or All-Off Command - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtBoth the number of steps (or levels) that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps can be modified to suit personal preferences. </p&gt <p&gtParameter 9 (number of steps or levels)</p&gt <p&gtParameter 10 (timing of the steps)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: All on/off timing
parameter.description: timing of the all on/off command<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen Receiving an All-On or All-Off Command - Dim Rate Adjustments</p&gt <p&gtThe number of steps that the dimmer will change and the timing of the steps. The timing of the steps is in 10 millisecond intervals. The default setting “1” means the level will change every 10 milliseconds when the Command is received, dimming will occur 3 times by default for a total of 30 ms. 255 would be every 2.55 seconds. Combined, the two parameters allow dim rates from 10 milliseconds to 4.2 minutes from maximum-to-minimum or minimum-to-maximum levels.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_29_1
parameter.label: 29: load sensing
parameter.description: turn ON when new bulb is sensed<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLoad sensing is disabled when shipped from the factory. Setting parameter 29 to a value of 1 will enable the Load Sense function.</p&gt <p&gtWhen replacing a burned-out light bulb, the load sensing feature (if enabled) will automatically turn the light ON when the new bulb is installed even if the Z-wave module was previously turned OFF.</p&gt</p&gt
